# Stakeholder Register

**Generated by:** ADPA (Automated Documentation Project Assistant)  
**Category:** stakeholder-management  
**Generated:** 2025-08-18  
**Project:** ADPA - Advanced Document Processing & Automation Framework

**PMBOK Reference:** 13.1.3.1

---

## Document Purpose

This Stakeholder Register identifies and documents all key project stakeholders for ADPA, including their roles, requirements, expectations, and influence. It serves as the foundation for stakeholder engagement, communication planning, and risk management throughout the lifecycle of this enterprise automation project.

---

## 1. Stakeholder Identification Summary

### Primary Stakeholders (High Power, High Interest)

- **Product Owner / Project Sponsor:** Oversees project objectives, funding, and strategic alignment.
- **Business Analysts:** Drive requirements gathering, standards compliance, and business analysis outputs.
- **Technical Leads / Solution Architects:** Responsible for architecture decisions, technology stack selection, and system integration.
- **Core Development Team:** Build, maintain, and deploy the ADPA framework (Node.js/TypeScript, CLI/API).
- **End Users (Enterprise Clients):** Use CLI, API, and web interfaces for document generation, integration, and workflow automation.

### Secondary Stakeholders (Variable Power/Interest)

- **QA/Test Engineers:** Ensure standards-compliant outputs and system reliability.
- **Enterprise IT Administrators:** Manage infrastructure, AD/Entra ID integration, and system security.
- **Compliance Managers:** Oversee regulatory adherence (GDPR, SOX, PCI DSS, Basel III, etc.).
- **Integration Partners:** Support connections to Confluence, SharePoint, Adobe, and version control systems.
- **Support & Documentation Team:** Maintain user guides, helpdesk, and training resources.
- **External AI Providers:** (OpenAI, Google AI, GitHub Copilot, Ollama) supply critical AI processing capabilities.
- **Regulatory Bodies:** Influence compliance requirements for financial, privacy, and security standards.

---

## 3. Organizational Stakeholders (Requires Organizational Input)

### Executive Stakeholders

**To complete:**  
- Project Sponsor (typically VP/Director of PMO or Digital Transformation)  
- Executive Sponsor (CIO, CTO, or Chief Data Officer)  
- Steering Committee Members (cross-departmental leadership)

**Instructions:**  
Consult your organizationâ€™s reporting structure and project governance to identify these individuals.

### Functional Stakeholders

**To complete:**  
- IT Department (Director, Infrastructure, Security, DevOps leads)
- Legal/Compliance (Data privacy, contracts, regulatory leads)
- Finance (Budget owner, controller, ROI analyst)
- Human Resources (Training, change management, org structure)

**Instructions:**  
Review Entra ID/Active Directory, internal org charts, and project charter for relevant contacts.

### External Stakeholders

**To complete:**  
- Vendors/Suppliers (e.g., Adobe, Microsoft, OpenAI)
- Regulatory Bodies (specific to your industry and geography)
- End Customers (if the project has a customer-facing component)

**Instructions:**  
Use procurement records, compliance registers, and customer success teams for identification.

## 4. Stakeholder Analysis Matrix

### Power/Interest Grid

| High Power, High Interest (Manage Closely)           | High Power, Low Interest (Keep Satisfied)         |
|------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------|
| Project Sponsor, Product Owner, Technical Lead       | Executive Sponsor, Regulatory Body                |
| Enterprise IT Admin                                 | Steering Committee Members                        |
| Business Analyst                                    | Finance Director (if budget is large)             |

| Low Power, High Interest (Keep Informed)             | Low Power, Low Interest (Monitor)                 |
|------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------|
| Developers, QA/Test Engineers, End Users             | Integration Partners, Support Team                |
| Documentation Specialist                            | External AI Providers (if peripheral)             |

## 5. Stakeholder Requirements and Expectations

| Stakeholder        | Preferred Communication Method | Frequency         | Key Information Needs                            |
|--------------------|-------------------------------|-------------------|--------------------------------------------------|
| Product Owner      | Email, Weekly Standups         | Weekly            | Progress, issues, risks, milestone updates       |
| Business Analyst   | Workshops, Shared Docs         | Bi-weekly         | Requirements traceability, standards coverage    |
| Technical Lead     | Slack/Teams, Design Reviews    | Weekly            | Architecture decisions, integration status       |
| Developer          | Agile Board, Daily Standups    | Daily             | Tasks, blockers, technical feedback             |
| QA Engineer        | Test Reports, Sprint Reviews   | Per sprint        | Defect logs, compliance test results             |
| IT Admin           | Email, Infra Dashboards        | As needed         | Security, identity integration, deployment logs  |
| Compliance Manager | Audit Meetings, Reports        | Monthly/Quarterly | Compliance status, risk register, audit trail    |
| Support/Docs Team  | Documentation Portal, Chat     | On demand         | Feature changes, training materials              |
| External AI Provider| API Portal, SLA Updates       | Monthly           | API reliability, security incidents              |
| Regulator          | Formal Reports, Compliance Mtgs| Annually/As needed| Audit results, regulatory changes, certifications|
| End User           | Feedback Surveys, User Forums  | Quarterly         | Usability, feature requests, issue resolution    |

*Update these preferences based on actual user interviews and organizational standards.*

## 6. Data Sources and Completion Instructions

### To Complete This Register:

1. **Validate Stakeholder List:** Cross-check with project charter, org chart, and user interviews.
2. **Consult Organizational Assets:**  
   - Organization charts, Entra ID/AD, previous registers, governance docs.
3. **Conduct Stakeholder Interviews:** Especially with high-power/high-interest groups.
4. **Update Contact Information:** Use org directory or ADPA admin portal.

### Recommended Next Steps:

1. **Stakeholder Analysis Workshop:** Review and validate this register with the project team.
2. **Stakeholder Interviews:** Meet individually with key stakeholders to refine requirements.
3. **Engagement Plan Development:** Use this register to build a PMBOK-compliant engagement plan.
4. **Regular Updates:** Review and update register as stakeholder landscape changes.
